Job Title: Lead Business Analyst - Clerk Grade 11/12 - Parliament of NSW - Sydney
Category:
Business/Systems Analysts (Information & Communication Technology)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Salary: $149,739 to $173,174 pa plus Super & Leave Loading
Ad Text:
About the role (Temporary for up to 12 months)


The Lead Business Analyst plays a critical role across the Parliament Information Management System (PIMS) Evolution Program and the Web Ecosystem Migration Program (WEMP), providing senior-level business analysis, strategic insight and cross-program coordination. This hands-on position leads the discovery, definition and validation of complex business and technical requirements across the two Houses, DPS, IT and vendor partners, while also providing capability leadership to Business Analysts, SMEs across the different departments and Houses (Legislative Assembly and Legislative Council), the Technical BA, Systems Analyst and UAT resources to ensure consistent, high-quality analysis practices across both programs.

Working closely with Program Managers, Product Owners and Technical Leads, the Lead Business Analyst ensures requirements and integration points are clearly understood, documented and sequenced to support Parliament’s transition to modern, scalable digital platforms, playing a pivotal role in shaping solutions, maturing BA capability and supporting the delivery of stable, efficient and high-impact digital services for the Parliament.

About us:

Based in NSW Parliament, the Department of Parliamentary Services (DPS) is a specialist service department working to support the operation of the Parliament of NSW by providing logistical support and advice to members, the Departments of the Legislative Council and Legislative Assembly and the people of New South Wales. Our office is found close to public transport in the heart of Macquarie Street CBD, next to the State Library and Sydney’s Botanic Gardens.

Enabling the Parliament, serving New South Wales: We demonstrate and foster in others a commitment to the five values of the Department of Parliamentary Services: collaboration, innovation, excellence, integrity and service.

Our commitment to diversity: We welcome applications from people from diverse backgrounds and encourage women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, LGBTQIA+, people with disability, mature-age people, and people from culturally diverse backgrounds to apply for this role.

Our people:

Our people have access to a range of benefits that help balance life at work and at home. Some of the benefits available when you join Parliament include:

Competitive salary and annual leave loading
35-hour week and flexible work options
Corporate Wellbeing programs including seminars and Fitness Passport
Free annual Influenza vaccination
Salary packaging options via superannuation contributions or a novated vehicle lease
On-site fitness facilities, pool, restaurant, cafes, and post office

About you:

We are seeking an experienced Lead Business Analyst with a strong background in delivering complex analysis across major digital transformation initiatives. The ideal candidate will bring deep technical literacy in SaaS platforms, API-driven integrations, data mapping, workflow transformation and cloud-aligned architectures, along with advanced skills in requirements elicitation, BPMN process modelling and solution validation. You will be proficient in tools such as Visio, Bizzdesign, JIRA, Confluence and Microsoft Office, and experienced in coordinating or guiding Business Analysts, Systems Analysts or UAT functions. Strong relationship-building skills are essential, as the role works closely with senior House SMEs, technical teams and Program Managers across PIMS Evolution and WEMP to shape high-quality outcomes and support Parliament’s transition to modern digital platforms

Further information to assist you with applying for this position:

Role Description
Department of Parliamentary Services website
NSW Parliament pre-employment requirements

How to apply:

To apply for this position please provide:

An up-to-date Resume [maximum five pages] which clearly details your skills and experience as relevant to this role and
A response [maximum two pages] to the Targeted Questions below.

Applications that do not include a response to the targeted questions will not be progressed to the next stage of assessment.  Copies of qualifications, certificates or documentation (other than requested) is not required at this stage in the recruitment process and will not be included with application documents.

Targeted questions:

1. PIMS Evolution involves modernising complex legacy systems, designing API-driven integrations, aligning data structures across platforms, and supporting the transition to SaaS and CMS environments. Can you describe a recent project where you played a senior role in defining technical requirements, data or integration patterns, or solution architecture? What approach did you take, and how did you ensure alignment across multiple teams or systems?

2. This role requires coordinating requirements and workflows across the Legislative Assembly, Legislative Council and DPS, each with different priorities and subject-matter expertise. Can you provide an example of how you have led a discovery, or requirements process across multiple business units with different needs? How did you manage competing priorities, bring stakeholders to agreement, and ensure high-quality outputs?

Electronic attachments must be MS Word compatible or in pdf format.

Technical assistance: Should you encounter any technical problems, please contact ‘I work for NSW’ or the helpdesk on 1800 562 679 (Monday - Friday).

To be eligible to apply for this role, you must meet one of the following criteria:

an Australian Citizen
a permanent resident of Australia; or
a New Zealand citizen.

Come and explore the Parliament online and click on our “360-degree Virtual Tour”: 

We will be conducting interviews in the New Year. Thank you for your interest in this role, and we look forward to receiving your application.

Job Reference: 492536

CLOSING DATE:  Sunday 21 December 2025 [11.55pm]

Category:
Business/Systems Analysts (Information & Communication Technology)
Other (Education & Training)
Ad Text:
People Insights Manager


Employment Type: Full Time (35 hours per week)
Duration: Continuing
Remuneration: Level 9 $148,012 - $157,056 (depending on experience) + 17% super + leave loading
Location: UNSW Kensington Campus, NSW (hybrid)

About UNSW:

UNSW isn’t like other places you’ve worked. Yes, we’re a large organisation with a diverse and talented community; a community doing extraordinary things. Together, we are driven to be thoughtful, practical, and purposeful in all we do. Taking this combined approach is what makes our work matter. It’s the reason we’re one of the top 20 universities in the world and a member of Australia’s prestigious Group of Eight. If you want a career where you can thrive, be challenged and do meaningful work, you’re in the right place.

Why Your Role Matters:

The People Insights Manager plays a pivotal role in advancing the University’s People & Culture reporting and analytics capability. This role shapes the future of workforce insights by transforming and elevating how data is used to solve complex business problems and support strategic decision-making.

You will lead the development of innovative reporting and analytics solutions, cultivate strong partnerships with key stakeholders, and translate business needs into meaningful, actionable insights. By fostering a collaborative and high-performing team environment, you will guide the People Insights function in its evolution toward a strategic workforce analytics capability.

The role reports to the Head of People Data & Insights and manages a team that may include Data Analysts, Data Engineers and Business Analysts.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead, mentor, and develop a high-performing analytics team.
Deliver and refine the People Data & Insights Strategy, driving innovation in dashboards and reporting.
Ensure accurate, reliable workforce data by identifying and resolving data quality issues.
Embed strong data governance practices aligned with UNSW policies, including secure data access and staff education.
Provide analytical expertise to P&C and University-wide initiatives, offering insights and solution-focused advice.
Build strong relationships across P&C, IT, Finance, UPP, and Student areas to deliver cohesive workforce data.
Oversee statutory and regulatory reporting (TCSI Staff Data, WGEA, ABS) and support audit data requests.
Contribute to long-term workforce planning by developing indicators and analysing workforce, student, and market trends.

About You:

Relevant qualifications and/or experience in workforce analytics, planning, recruitment, resourcing, or P&C in a corporate/professional setting.
Strong capability working with complex datasets and creating intuitive dashboards (ideally in Power BI).
Solid end-to-end data skills - definition, collection, cleaning, extraction, analysis, and validation.
Understanding of HR practices, compliance, and workforce planning (desirable).
Proven leadership skills with experience prioritising work, developing staff, and delivering high-quality insights.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to simplify complex information and influence stakeholders.
Strong analytical, organisational, and problem-solving abilities with a high attention to detail.
Customer-focused mindset with a record of delivering effective business solutions.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (advanced Excel), SQL, PeopleSoft Query, and data visualisation tools.

For further details on role responsibilities and skills & experience required, refer to the position description found under the position listing on Jobs@UNSW

Benefits and Culture:

People are at the core of everything we do. We recognise it is the contributions of our staff who make UNSW one of the best universities in Australia and the world.

Our benefits include:

Flexible working options.
Career development opportunities.
17% Superannuation contributions and additional leave loading payments.
Additional 3 days of leave over Christmas period.
Discounts and entitlements (retail, education, fitness).

For further details on the benefits, please visit https://www.jobs.unsw.edu.au/lifestyle-benefits

How to Apply: Submit your CV & a succinct one-page cover letter detailing your interest and suitability for the job (as per the skills & experience bullet points in the job description) by 11:55pm, 4th January 2026
Please note: Sponsorship is not available for this role, valid Australian working rights are required on application.

Contact: Amy Denney a.denney@unsw.edu.au - Talent Acquisition Team
Please apply directly through the website, applications sent to the contact above will not be accepted.

UNSW is committed to equity diversity and inclusion. Applications from women, people of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, those living with disabilities, members of the LGBTIQ+ community; and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, are encouraged. UNSW provides workplace adjustments for people with disability, and access to flexible work options for eligible staff.

The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment.
